DASD Families,
We are very excited to welcome students back this Thursday, September 3 whether in our buildings, our Bridge, or Ironmen Cyber Academy and eLearning GradPoint educational programs. As we make final preparations I wanted to share information about the Masking Requirements. According to DOH:
“Schools must require all students over 2 years of age to wear face coverings, except for any student who has a medical or mental health condition or disability that precludes the wearing of a face covering in school. Notwithstanding Section 3, Paragraph B of Secretary Levine’s July 1, 2020 Order regarding face coverings, schools may require such students to provide medical documentation.”
Please understand that students will be required to have a face covering (may be a face shield), unless medical documentation has been provided and accommodations discussed with the parents. We are looking forward to seeing the students soon - Dr. Boyle

The Danville Area NHS Kindness Campaign

Beginning from Danville High School’s National Honor Society, the goal of the Kindness Campaign is to alleviate stress from the student body, bring positivity into the community, and of course, to remember that kind gestures (big or small) can have an impact.

One corresponding activity is our Kindness Rocks Project, which helps to enforce the spreading of uplifting words in our community. Another extension of our campaign is raising money for the National Tay-Sachs and Allied Diseases Association. Inspired by a family friend who lost a son to Tay-Sachs, the whole campaign functions to honor and commemorate his life. All donations received will then be given to the NTSAD in his memory.

We can’t wait to see the effects the campaign will have in our town and surrounding areas.

Be kind today!

Due to the cancellation of school today, we will be moving the 8th grade Parent/Guardian Night to February 6th at 7:00 pm in the High School Auditorium.
